db:article.db:para: Prevents forcing source files to be treated as UTF-8 for Windows.

This command was introduced in Qt 6.0.

db:section.db:title: Synopsis
db:section.db:para: If versionless commands are disabled, use qt6_allow_non_utf8_sources() instead. It supports the same set of arguments as this command.

db:section.db:title: Description
db:section.db:para: When building with some compilers for Windows, targets that link to a Qt library will use flags that force the compiler to treat its source files as UTF-8. This is currently implemented for Visual Studio and Intel compilers. You can disable this behavior on a per-target basis by calling qt_allow_non_utf8_sources() and passing the target as the argument.

db:note.db:para: This does not change the runtime behavior of classes like QString (its constructor from const char * requires properly encoded UTF-8 input). Use the QT_NO_CAST_FROM_ASCII and QT_RESTRICTED_CAST_FROM_ASCII macros to help identify such code.
